metrics.name: Total number of open incidents
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id) FILTER (WHERE 
	(SELECT BOOL_AND(
 NOT event_name IN (${incident_closure_events})))
)

metrics.name: Average response time
metrics.description: Average time from incident creation to first response
metrics.signalFragment:
AVG(
	(SELECT LAST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN (${response_events}))
	-(SELECT FIRST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN (${incident_creation_events}))
)

metrics.name: Average resolution time
metrics.description: Average time from incident creation to its resolution
metrics.signalFragment:
AVG(
	(SELECT LAST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN (${resolution_events}))
	-(SELECT FIRST(end_time)
		WHERE event_name IN (${incident_creation_events}))
)

metrics.name: First call resolution rate
metrics.description: Percentage of incidents that are resolved without any rework. Rework is defined here as any case that contains the same event name more than once.

metrics.name: SLA breach ratio
metrics.description: Percentage of cases that have breached the SLAs
metrics.signalFragment:
COUNT(case_id) FILTER (WHERE 
	 (SELECT BOOL_OR(
 event_name IN (${itr_sla_breach_events})))
)/ COUNT(case_id)
* 100

metrics.name: Average ticket reassignment rate
metrics.description: Average number of reassignments per case

metrics.name: High priority incident ratio
metrics.description: Percentage of cases with high priority

variables.name: incident_closure_events
variables.description: Events defining the closing events of a case, for example 'Close Incident'

variables.name: incident_creation_events
variables.description: Events defining the start events of a case, for example 'Create Problem', 'Create Incident'

variables.name: response_events
variables.description: Events defining the response to a recently opened case, for example 'Assign ticket', 'Create ticket'

variables.name: resolution_events
variables.description: Events defining the resolution of a case, for example 'Close Incident', 'Mark Incident as Resolved'

variables.name: itr_sla_breach_events
variables.description: Events that mark the time when the SLA was breached, for example 'Incident Resolution SLA Breached'

defaultValues.defaultValue: 'Incident Response SLA Breached','Incident Resolution SLA Breached'

variables.name: incident_reassignments
variables.description: Attribute referring to the reassignment count for incidents, for example, in ServiceNow it is called "IncidentReassignmentCount"

variables.name: rework_condition
variables.description: Condition defining a rework event, for example "COUNT(event_name) > COUNT(DISTINCT event_name)" and "IncidentReassignmentCount >= 1"

variables.name: high_priority
variables.description: Condition defining cases with high priority, for example "IncidentPriority = 1" or "IncidentCategory = 'Urgent'"
